 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנַ֫יִם‎</span> **noun masculine dual** ==loins== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***back***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***the two sides of the back***, etc.; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Deut.33.11|Deut 33:11]] + 7 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנָ֑יִם‎</span> [[Ezek.29.7|Ezek 29:7]]; [[Ezek.47.4|Ezek 47:4]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנֵי‎</span> [[Jer.13.11|Jer 13:11]] + 3t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנַי‎</span> [[Isa.21.3|Isa 21:3]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנָ֑י‎</span> [[Jer.13.2|Jer 13:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנֵיהֶם‎</span> 1 Kings + [[Jer.20.32|Jer 20:32]] + 4 t., etc.; — ***loins:*** 

**1. a.** ==place of wearing girdle== [[1Kgs.2.5|1Kgs 2:5]]; [[2Kgs.1.8|2Kgs 1:8]]; [[Jer.13.1|Jer 13:1]]; [[Jer.13.2|Jer 13:2]]; [[Jer.13.4|Jer 13:4]]; [[Jer.13.11|Jer 13:11]]; [[Ezek.23.15|Ezek 23:15]] figurative [[Isa.11.5|Isa 11:5]] ***righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins***. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** hence place of things attached to girdle: — sword girded on (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגר על‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אסר‎</span> [[2Sam.20.8|2Sam 20:8]]; [[Neh.4.12|Neh 4:12]] opposed to, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמָתְנֵי מְלָכִים אֲפַתֵּחַ‎</span> [[Isa.45.1|Isa 45:1]] ***and the loins of kings I will loosen***, i e. will disarm them (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> before Cyrus; compare [[BDB#Che|Che]]); ink-horn [[Ezek.9.2|Ezek 9:2]]; [[Ezek.9.3|Ezek 9:3]]; [[Ezek.9.11|Ezek 9:11]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** girding up ***loins*** = make ready for action, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְשַׁנֵּס‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָתְנָיו‎</span> [[1Kgs.18.46|1Kgs 18:46]] more often <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָגַר מ‎</span> [[2Kgs.4.29|2Kgs 4:29]]; [[2Kgs.9.1|2Kgs 9:1]]; [[Exod.12.11|Exod 12:11]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Dan.10.5|Dan 10:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָזַר מ‎</span> [[Jer.1.17|Jer 1:17]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זַרְזִיר מ‎</span> [[Prov.30.31|Prov 30:31]] that which is ***girt in the loins***, i.e. probably either a ***greyhound*** [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Bö|Bö]] [[BDB#De|De]] (contracted, as if by a belt), or a war-horse, charger, [[BDB#Bo|Bo]] [[BDB#Ges|Ges]] [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Str|Str]] [[BDB#Wild|Wild]] (with a saddle); compare also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זרזיר‎</span>, p. 267 above; text perhaps corrupt ([[BDB#Wild|Wild]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** girded with sackcloth (in mourning) [[Gen.37.34|Gen 37:34]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), [[Amos.8.10|Amos 8:10]]; [[Isa.20.2|Isa 20:2]]; [[1Kgs.20.31|1Kgs 20:31]]; [[1Kgs.20.32|1Kgs 20:32]]; [[Jer.48.37|Jer 48:37]]. **feminine** ==linen breeches of priests were to extend== <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִמָּתְנַיִם וְעַד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְרֵכַיִם‎</span> [[Exod.28.42|Exod 28:42]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); to be <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלמָֿת‎</span> [[Ezek.44.18|Ezek 44:18]] loins of slaves are girt with waistcloth, compare [[Job.12.18|Job 12:18]] (see also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵזוֺר‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **g.** in general of the middle of the body, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵי מָת‎</span> [[Ezek.47.4|Ezek 47:4]] (i.e. water reaching to the loins); so of the appearance of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> in Ezekiel's visions [[Ezek.1.27|Ezek 1:27]] (twice in verse); [[Ezek.8.2|Ezek 8:2]] (twice in verse). 

**2. a.** ***loins*** as seat of strength, [[Deut.33.11|Deut 33:11]]; [[1Kgs.12.10|1Kgs 12:10]] = [[2Chr.10.10|2Chr 10:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַזֵּק מָתְנַיִם‎</span> [[Nah.2.2|Nah 2:2]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַמֵּץ כֹּחַ‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֹּחוֺ בְּמָתְנָיו‎</span> [[Job.40.16|Job 40:16]] (of hippopotamus); in combination with **1 a** (figurative) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָֽגְרָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּעוֺז מ‎</span> [[Prov.31.17|Prov 31:17]] ***she girdeth her loins with strength***, she puts on energy with her girdle; compare also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּשִׁבְרוֺן מ‎</span> [[Ezek.21.11|Ezek 21:11]] sigh ***with breaking of loins***, i.e. in entire collapse of strength; so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּמִיד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמְעַ֑ד וּמ‎</span> [[Ps.69.24|Ps 69:24]] ***and make their loins continually to shake***, make them totter; compare [[Ezek.29.7|Ezek 29:7]] (where read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִמְעַדְתָּ‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהַעֲמַדְתָּ‎</span>, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָעַד‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** as seat of keenest pain, due to grief or dread [[Nah.2.11|Nah 2:11]]; [[Isa.21.3|Isa 21:3]] (as in travail); so probably also [[Ps.66.11|Ps 66:11]] (compare [[BDB#Bae|Bae]]; and see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוּעָקָה‎</span> below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוק‎</span>).
